page.title: 01"Metheringham Village Lincs"
page.content: Metheringham is a large rural village 9 miles South-East of Lincoln and 9 miles North of Sleaford. The village had a large area of cultivated land supporting several hundred people in 1086. The present population is 2950. Only a small percentage of the people now work on the land though the shops, businesses, the surgery, a small industrial estate and the school provides employment.However, a large mumber of people commute to Lincoln travelling by car, bus or train.There are many clubs and organisations in the village catering for the recreational and social needs of the people.Most of the older houses are limestone. Dwellings built in the last twenty years are mostly bungalows. The village has a church, two chapels and four pubs.
